ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version
e.g., ''Thinking of your entire lifetime'' or ''Since April 1, 2020''

ElementDescription: How important is religion in your life? Would you say:
Notes: 1 = Very important; 2 = Somewhat important; 3 = Not really important; 4 = Not at all important; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: How important is spirituality in your life? Would you say:
Notes: 1 = Very important; 2 = Somewhat important; 3 = Not really important; 4 = Not at all important; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: What is your religious preference? Are you:
Notes: 1 = Protestant (any denomination including Baptist, Lutheran, Methodist, Mormon, Presbyterian, United Church of Christ, Christian); 2 = Catholic; 3 = Jewish; 4 = Muslim; 95 = Something else; 96 = No religious preference; 99 = No answer

ElementDescription: Does your religion discourage drinking of alcoholic beverages?
